result.execSummary:
The defendant Danny L. Benford Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Danny L. Benford Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Danny L. Benford Jr was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Danny L. Benford Jr was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Danny L. Benford Jr was found guilty of 1st Degree Reckless Injury, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(1)(a).
  • Danny L. Benford Jr was found guilty of Aggravated Battery-Intend GreatBod. Harm, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(5).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
